comments.author: kirstenkobilsek@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When visiting a YouTube video and then leaving the page and opening a new YouTube video briefly shows the last visited video.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to http://www.youtube.com/
2. Click a random video (Not VEVO)
3. Click the back button
4. Click another random video (again not VEVO)

Actual Results:  
Old video shows briefly.

Expected Results:  
Only new video loads.

It does not happen on IE.
comments.creator: kirstenkobilsek@gmail.com

When visiting a YouTube video and then leaving the page and opening a new YouTube video briefly shows the last visited video.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to http://www.youtube.com/
2. Click a random video (Not VEVO)
3. Click the back button
4. Click another random video (again not VEVO)

Actual Results:  
Old video shows briefly.

Expected Results:  
Only new video loads.

It does not happen on IE.

Created attachment 520545
Screenshot showing the effect

This screenshot shows the effect, the video, takes 3:46, however the old video shown, note how the controls show a duration of 5:00
